Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from Teman (תֵּימָנִי) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב) who comes to comfort but concludes by arguing with Job
= descendant or inhabitant of Teman (תֵּימָן)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: to test; hence: = action by which humans make an effort to engage in a certain activity

Node.gloss: to withhold|to prevent|to keep from|to stop from|to close
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities keep people or objects from activities that they are normally involved in

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to be mentally strong
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which human help other humans to find the courage to perform a certain event

literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans to be mentally strong able to deal with issues relating to their daily work and to morals and ethics
literally: to stumble; hence: hence: process by which humans go through a time in which they are unable to cope with the circumstances they have to deal with
= central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength
literally: to collapse; hence: process by which humans go through a time in which they are unable to cope with the circumstances they have to deal with

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to support|to repair|to let grow strong
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause inanimate objects or (other) humans to have physical, political, and/or military strength
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: to reach; hence: = process by which a certain event reaches the time for it to take place
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

Node.gloss: to be in anguish|to be dismayed
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such trembling and pain
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which humans experience fear
= state where humans feel confident◄ due to their reliance on God or something else for protection

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= causitive action or process by which humans or deities forcibly terminate the existence of an individual or group of people
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= causative action by which someone causes an entire sequence of events to take place by performing the first event in the sequence; only used for events that are considered morally and ethically unacceptable
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
literally: (God's) breath; hence: = process by which humans are punished by God, ◄ described as a flaming breath coming from his mouth
= part of the body projecting above the mouth on the face of a person or animal, containing the two nostrils|= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: to finish; hence: = process by which humans and objects completely disappear from existence
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male lion (אֲרִי) that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous
= causative action by which someone removes an object with force from the place to which it was attached
= male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ seen as a strong and fearless animal

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare
= direct offspring of animals, either male or indeterminate

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
= to be divided into smaller groups or individuals; ► which may result in losing the strength, power, and confidence that are characteristic of belonging to a larger group
= causative action by which someone causes someone else to move somewhere quietly or surreptitiously, like a thief who does not want to be seen
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= words uttered very softly, usually without engaging one's vocal cords
= process by which the mind of humans is filled with distressing thoughts
= series of pictures or events in mind of sleeping person; ≈ associated with things that disappear in a moment
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
= state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with having dreams and visions, sometimes with being inactive
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= process by which the human body shakes, ◄ as a result of fear
literally: to meet; hence: = process by which a certain event starts affecting someone
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= a spiritual entity coming over humans and triggering attitudes corresponding to its character and purpose
= action by which deities or humans move from one location to another

= the fine thread like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals; ≈ one single strand can be used as a symbol for a very small distance or quantity, whereas the collective of strands often symbolizes a great quantity
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events
= the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= a soft, hushed sound, if any sound at all, ≈ signifying the opposite of the loud noise produced by a storm, thunder, earthquakes etc.
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
literally: to be clean; hence: = state in which humans are free of moral contamination and acceptable to God
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

Node.gloss: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon|to bring upon|to impose upon|to charge with|to commit to
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities hold (other) humans responsible for an event that has taken place or that is to take place in the future

marker pointing to information that substantiates a particular assertion even more conclusively than previous information, which was presented in an immediately preceding utterance as an valid substantiation of that assertion

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it
= causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

= smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to pull out|to pull up|to uproot|to quarry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

Node.gloss: to pull up (someone's) tent cord > to cause someone to die
Node.definition: literally: to pull up (someone's) tent cord; hence: = causative action by which an end is made to a human life ◄ as if it were a tent of which the cords are pulled up so that it will collapse
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
